comments:
I use Eclipse 3.1 200410050800 to develop JDK 1.5 application. My application
has few custom ANT tasks and I use these tasks in application's build.xml. I use
SUN JDK 1.4.2 to run Eclipse itself. When I edit the build.xml in ANT editor and
try to save it, I get error popup about unsupported major.minor version. Here is
a stack trace

The tasks are compiled using 1.5 and then within Eclipse we are attempting to 
resolve the tasks running in the 1.4.2 VM. 

Two workarounds: 
    compile the tasks using 1.4.2 (or at least the target set to 1.4)
    disable Window>Preferences>Ant>Editor>Code Assist>Provide proposals for 
user defined tasks

Other workaround is to start Eclipse using 1.5
Nothing planned. The user will have to match correctly between the Eclipse 
runtime JRE/JDK and the JDK used to compile the Ant tasks.
